titleInfo.title: Second Infantry Brigade, Tennessee State Guard map of Middle Tennessee

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: Map depicting the Middle Tennessee area of operation for the Second Infantry Brigade of the Tennessee State Guard. Featured on the map are cities and towns, major highways, parks, rivers, dams, and bridges. The brigade headquarters in Nashville is marked by a flag.

The Second Infantry Brigade was formed by a May 1942 reorganization of the Tennessee State Guard. It was commanded by Brig. Gen. Jacob McGavock Dickinson and headquartered in Nashville. The Brigade was composed of the Second Regiment, headquartered in Nashville, the Seventh Regiment, headquartered in Cookeville, and the Tenth Regiment, headquartered in Pulaski. This map was probably produced to assist in the staging of State Guard maneuvers and exercises.
